page.title: 15FALLING SALMON RUNS AT DRUM
page.content: An old Scots saying well known in the North East: {'A mile o the Don is worth twa o Dee, { except for salmon, steen or tree' proclaims the good farmland of Donside but the excellence of{salmon fishing} and scenery on Deeside. The main salmon fishing beats on the Dee at Drumoak are Middle Drum,Upper Drum and Park.Middle Drum has recorded a total catch of{24 salmon}up to 24/6/85,the{poorest catch on record. Park House records also show the worst season since records began. Riparian owners indicate that heavy netting of the river mouth and off-shore netting are responsible for ever decreasing spring runs of salmon. The River Dee salmon fishing is very important to the whole Deeside area both for the{jobs it creates}and the tourist{currency it generates. }
